title: RGM brain dump. ARURF death timers, RGM custom games and more.
body:
Heya guys, feels like a good time for one of these again. <3 I've gathered a heap of common RGM questions in here, but feel free to hit me up in the comments with anything else. I'll be around for a while, give me a poke. o^_^O

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/rgm-banner_1920x1080.jpg

**ARURF Death Timers**
While it feels like it might be fun to apply the URF buff to death timers as well, this would impact game length pretty severely. If champions respawned any quicker than usual in ARURF, games would drag on-and-on while turtling defenses could continue to hold out forever on the fountain. :(

Death timers in ARURF are actually the same, if not shorter than regular SR right now. They're also unchanged from regular old URF. Average champion level is generally higher in URF though comparative to game time, meaning towers can feel a little weaker than usual. We'd still rather a snowballing game close-out than drag on forever though, so you can quickly get into the next match.

The worst feeling would be bumping up against a stubborn, frustrating defense that isn't earned through player skill, just facilitated by unnecessarily short death timers.

**RGM mode custom games**
We still haven't been able add support for custom games in the new league client. This #feelsbadman. :( I was sad we didn't have custom games for the new Blood Moon mode. I'm sad we don't have them for ARURF. I hope we can get them working ASAP. We want to do our community games again with you guys. They are not missing by design, we're working to get them back.

**Old mode experimentation on PBE**
There's a few modes we've run quite a lot (Poro King and Ascension in particular). They're both quite popular modes with healthy engagement, which made them good candidates for filler in between our bigger new modes (like Blood Moon or the new Doom Bots) that we run! Obviously we can't make a Blood Moon mode every patch though (as much as we'd like to), so inevitably we enable modes like Poro King and Ascension to make sure there's still something light and fun to do on the weekends alongside ARAM, rather than nothing at all.

We're interested in seeing if there's some unique twists we can put on these modes though to further freshen them up. Right now on PBE we have a version of Poro King with Doom Bots style Ryze portals everywhere. We're going to watch it very closely. PBE is a place for us to test and gauge. We might delete it. **We might change it entirely. It's an experiment.** #PBEthings

This also doesn't mean we aren't still actively working on bigger new modes similar to Blood Moon that just released. We are actually focusing even more on modes like that this year, but in between those big mode drops, we still need to use reliable modes like Poro King to fill the gaps. Hopefully we can also expand the roster with modes like One For All once we get support for it in the new client too.

**Why not put 'Mode X' into the RGM queue?**
If "Mode X" hasn't appeared by now, it's probably because we weren't happy with the design of it and the outcomes (some exceptions are "One For All: SR" and "Hexakill: TT", which are currently blocked due to tech reasons on the new client). We're still building support for a few modes in the new client, but older ones like Showdown or One For All: Mirror Mode just missed the bar on what we expect from an alternate game mode. I won't say "never" in game dev because anything could happen, but it's unlikely we'll bring modes like these back. That also doesn't mean that the core idea might not still be fun (the idea of an intense 1v1 is kinda cool) but we wouldn't use that particular execution of the idea. We'd most like build a newer, better version, that better executes on that gameplay fantasy.

-- L4T3NCY

replies.body: Any plans for BMB? I was a low level player back when it was released and I missed it, so it would be nice if it could come back. I know in the past it's been stated that it's difficult due to tech reasons, so I guess my question is simply whether it's still on the table eventually, or if it's been scrapped.

Hey Latency!

Thanks for the brain dump! It answered what few questions I had, save for one.

Is Nemesis Draft still on the table for getting added into the regular RGM lineup?

I'll say "doubtful" on Nemesis Draft. We ran it again one more time last year just to check, and it didn't seem super compelling. Good maybe for a laugh or two but, not really a whole alternate game mode. :P

Any hope for nemesis draft as a spin on other alternate game modes, rather than a mode itself? e.g. Nemesis URF 

AR is pretty good I suppose, but still has the issue of people with small champ pools (unless AR picks from the entire champ pool now and I've missed it), and the implication that people probably know the champs they own. 

Adventures with champions you potentially have literally never played before makes for spicy adventures.

We talked about this one, "using Nemesis Draft as a mutator on other modes".

The place we always landed though was, "ultimately you end up playing with a bunch of champs you don't like." This can be true in ARAM sometimes too, but at least the system is fair and you also had a relatively equal chance to also get a champ you like (assuming equal like/dislike champ proportions).

When it's a human giving out the champs though, it's almost 100% champs that _nobody_ likes (except that one Urgod). To be fair, that is the gimmick of the mode, but I'm not sure that would be an improvement on modes where you're rather just pick/roll something fun instead.

I actually liked Nemesis Draft and was really disappointed it didnt come back. Im sure Im not the only one. Playing champs we "dont like" is fine because everyone is in it together. In random modes like ARURF its very unfun because other people may be playing champs they are skilled with.

bro, I love playing Nemesis Draft.

all season long we get flamed for not picking meta champs.
Nemesis Draft come along, they grovel for the taste of victory as we carry them with Nunu/Skarner/Urgot/Mordekaiser.

We talked about this exact idea (but not on Butcher's Bridge, just using regular Howling Abyss for now). The current test on PBE is _very_ experimental, so we might try this idea out too at some point next week.

If I may ask, I got a few questions in mind:

1.) **What is your guys' opinion on enabling the whole champion pool insead of just the player's champion pool?** For most of us with all the champions, its a bit of a bummer that we are at a disadvantage because people have practiced with a smaller pool. I understand not wanting to play a champ you don't own, however.

2.) Is there any information regarding Black Market Brawlers? I thought that was an amazing mode, would hate for it to go to waste.

3.) Maybe a hint at the next new gamemode ;) (preferably a hint related to food, if possible.)
Hey L4T3NCY can i ask for your thoughts on adding bans to AURF since I know some people want it or does it defeat the Random purpose

I'm not against the idea of bans in ARURF. We should make sure they're for the right reason though. Our goal is never to "balance" alternate game modes, but if they play nicely with the reroll/trade system's existing mitigation of the champion RNG, then maybe.
But you guys literally added the All random to urf to balance it...

ARURF does nothing to balance URF. If you roll an OP champ they're still just the same, their dmg, HP, etc is unchanged. ARURF tackles the stagnation and unhealthy engagement we saw with regular URF. It seemed to do pretty well the last time we ran it, so we're running it again in 7.4.

Add 5 bans each to URF. RNG feels terrible.  I basically can't play it on my account that owns all the champions, because despite owning them all, I don't enjoy playing a lot of champions, and a lot of them are frankly extremely weak in URF.  ARURF is just like ARAM, the team with the most poke wins.  Except there is a distinct lack of counterplay because CD's are nonexistent.  It doesn't matter if you dodged their poke, you can't think about engaging because it's just going to hit you in the face when you move forward.  It's not the direction to take URF.  I've played one game and I'm done with it already because it was just such a terrible experience.  It's unfun for the same reasons ARAM can be unfun, except it emphasizes weaknesses and offers little recourse.  At least with ARAM you are grouped as 5 and can weather the storm as a team, along with exp and gold gain is much better for keeping a team that lost the champion lottery relevant and feeling like they can even do something.  In ARURF you have to defend lanes.  Too much gold is spread out across the map to not try, yet if everyone is just in a losing matchup you get snowballed on and die anyways.
Are we every going to get normal URF back or are we stuck with ARURF forever?
OT But since you are the game mode guy, will you guys also continue to improve upon practice tool as well
Yes, planning a light quality-of-life update to Practice Tool sometime soon(tm). :D

So can we talk about why riot won't make these game modes actually random?

I get the argument of a player not knowing a champion but with a gamemode meant for fun trying something new every now and then isn't exactly world changing especially when free week champions can do this to a player anyway. 

Your random aspect to game modes is rendered almost pointless when I can make an account with only the busted champions and run that every time. You essentially force higher mmr players to make new accounts to stack or just stop playing due to the frustration of having to fight broken every game while they are playing with a large champion pool.
Is there any chance that we'll ever see regular, non-random URF again?

> If "Mode X" hasn't appeared by now, it's probably because we weren't happy with the design of it and the outcomes (some exceptions are "One For All: SR" and "Hexakill: TT", which are currently blocked due to tech reasons on the new client).

Is it safe to assume that Black Market Brawlers didn't feel different enough to make a comeback? I know I personally enjoyed the special minions an items it offered (only wishing it had been on Butchers Bridge or another themed map) and have been hoping for a return.

I made a thread earlier proposing a solution to the URF vs ARURF debate.

My proposed solution: **URF is brought back. _However, using a champion in URF disables further use of that champion. This applies up to TEN times. After use of at least ten different champions, the first champion you played becomes 'unlocked' again, and so on._ **

This would let us choose our champions, while still forcing champion diversity. Would this idea work?

This would suck dick tbh.

What if you use your fav champ, but that game goes really shitty and you're matched with toxic people that feed, grief, flame, etc, and just ruin the gameplay aspect of h match?

And now you wasted your fav champ on a shitty match.

Bad idea.
Better then not getting to play your fav champ at all. Since it looks like Riot is simply refusing to give us regular URF. And they wont even tell us why.

They could just give us both simultaneously. It would increase queue times for each, but they're already so low that you're probably looking at 1 minute max regardless, and then the ones who want normal URF have it, and the ones who prefer ARURF have that as well.
But that would make too much sense.

Okay, this is an honest question: is there any chance we will ever get normal URF back? I'd even be fine with a lockout timer on champions we've played in the past 10 games or something to prevent literally everyone from just spamming the same 5 op champs. I just personally really dislike the fact that we get no say whatsoever on the champions that our team gets. I understand that the meta got pretty stale pretty quickly, but to be fair that happens in every game mode.

To be fair, I do say this as a Zed main that loves playing just about every mid champion in URF, and I can recognize the fact that those are probably some of the least fun champions to play against in the mode, but it honestly just feels really bad to have no control over whether your team (or the enemy team) gets those champions - you end up losing or winning in champ select like 90% of games with no control.

And my question is, why is that a bad thing?

I acknowledge that there are lots of us who dislike it, lots of us who dislike how unbalancing original urf is and how the meta champs are op.  

But - someone gave a beautiful comment about it when ARURF was introduced - those are exactly the reasons why those who love urf loved it. We liked it precisely because it is not balanced, and we enjoyed playing those op champions over and over.

L4T3NCY mentioned that the randomness isn't an act of balancing, and I somewhat admit that, but still, it took away the appeal and raised the suffering just like nemesis or one for all did (players raging or getting blamed for having no idea how to play undesired champs). ARURF doesn't offer what urf does, thus I don't see these two modes as anything remotely close to each other and naively hope to have urf back, which tbh is very unlikely to happen. 

P.S. One last rant. I still don't get it. Normal game modes are where balance and fairness belong. URF is not intended to be balanced, it is a sanctuary for those who can abuse it, so why are we trying to mess it up? Sorry, I just can't help it, urf had been my favorite game mode miles ahead of any other and I've been grumpy ever since it got replaced with arurf.

I agree with what you've said to be honest. I simply wanted to mention that I understand why some people prefer ARURF, and I would totally be fine with ARURF staying around - it's just that I would love to have the option of normal URF too. In fact I'd be totally cool with it if they just released both side-by-side. Then those of us who prefer regular URF can play that and those who prefer ARURF can play that too. We'd both have slightly longer queue times, but they're so low anyway that you'd be waiting a minute at most to be getting into either one. I really don't see the downside to at least giving us the option.
